00063 static int __osd_init_iobuf(struct osd_device *d, struct osd_iobuf *iobuf,
00064                             int rw, int line, int pages)
00065 {
00066         int blocks, i;
00067 
00068         LASSERTF(iobuf->dr_elapsed_valid == 0,
00069                  "iobuf %p, reqs %d, rw %d, line %d\n", iobuf,
00070                  atomic_read(&iobuf->dr_numreqs), iobuf->dr_rw,
00071                  iobuf->dr_init_at);
00072         LASSERT(pages <= PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES);
00073 
00074         init_waitqueue_head(&iobuf->dr_wait);
00075         atomic_set(&iobuf->dr_numreqs, 0);
00076         iobuf->dr_npages = 0;
00077         iobuf->dr_error = 0;
00078         iobuf->dr_dev = d;
00079         iobuf->dr_frags = 0;
00080         iobuf->dr_elapsed = 0;
00081         /* must be counted before, so assert */
00082         iobuf->dr_rw = rw;
00083         iobuf->dr_init_at = line;
00084 
00085         blocks = pages * (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> osd_sb(d)->s_blocksize_bits);
00086         if (iobuf->dr_bl_buf.lb_len >= blocks * sizeof(iobuf->dr_blocks[0])) {
00087                 LASSERT(iobuf->dr_pg_buf.lb_len >=
00088                         pages * sizeof(iobuf->dr_pages[0]));
00089                 return 0;
00090         }
00091 
00092         /* start with 1MB for 4K blocks */
00093         i = 256;
00094         while (i <= PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES && i < pages)
00095                 i <<= 1;
00096 
00097         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "realloc %u for %u (%u) pages\n",
00098                (unsigned)(pages * sizeof(iobuf->dr_pages[0])), i, pages);
00099         pages = i;
00100         blocks = pages * (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> osd_sb(d)->s_blocksize_bits);
00101         iobuf->dr_max_pages = 0;
00102         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "realloc %u for %u blocks\n",
00103                (unsigned)(blocks * sizeof(iobuf->dr_blocks[0])), blocks);
00104 
00105         lu_buf_realloc(&iobuf->dr_bl_buf, blocks * sizeof(iobuf->dr_blocks[0]));
00106         iobuf->dr_blocks = iobuf->dr_bl_buf.lb_buf;
00107         if (unlikely(iobuf->dr_blocks == NULL))
00108                 return -ENOMEM;
00109 
00110         lu_buf_realloc(&iobuf->dr_pg_buf, pages * sizeof(iobuf->dr_pages[0]));
00111         iobuf->dr_pages = iobuf->dr_pg_buf.lb_buf;
00112         if (unlikely(iobuf->dr_pages == NULL))
00113                 return -ENOMEM;
00114 
00115         iobuf->dr_max_pages = pages;
00116 
00117         return 0;
00118 }
00119 #define osd_init_iobuf(dev, iobuf, rw, pages) \
00120         __osd_init_iobuf(dev, iobuf, rw, __LINE__, pages)
00121 
00122 static void osd_iobuf_add_page(struct osd_iobuf *iobuf, struct page *page)
00123 {
00124         LASSERT(iobuf->dr_npages < iobuf->dr_max_pages);
00125         iobuf->dr_pages[iobuf->dr_npages++] = page;
00126 }
00127 
00128 void osd_fini_iobuf(struct osd_device *d, struct osd_iobuf *iobuf)
00129 {
00130         int rw = iobuf->dr_rw;
00131 
00132         if (iobuf->dr_elapsed_valid) {
00133                 iobuf->dr_elapsed_valid = 0;
00134                 LASSERT(iobuf->dr_dev == d);
00135                 LASSERT(iobuf->dr_frags > 0);
00136                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&d->od_brw_stats.
00137                                  hist[BRW_R_DIO_FRAGS+rw],
00138                                  iobuf->dr_frags);
00139                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&d->od_brw_stats.hist[BRW_R_IO_TIME+rw],
00140                                       iobuf->dr_elapsed);
00141         }
00142 }
00143 
00144 #ifndef REQ_WRITE /* pre-2.6.35 */
00145 #define __REQ_WRITE BIO_RW
00146 #endif
00147 
00148 static void dio_complete_routine(struct bio *bio, int error)
00149 {
00150         struct osd_iobuf *iobuf = bio->bi_private;
00151 #ifdef HAVE_BVEC_ITER
00152         struct bvec_iter iter;
00153         struct bio_vec bvl;
00154 #else
00155         int iter;
00156         struct bio_vec *bvl;
00157 #endif
00158 
00159         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: possibly in IRQ context
00160          * DO NOT record procfs stats here!!! */
00161 
00162         if (unlikely(iobuf == NULL)) {
00163                 CERROR("***** bio->bi_private is NULL!  This should never "
00164                        "happen.  Normally, I would crash here, but instead I "
00165                        "will dump the bio contents to the console.  Please "
00166                        "report this to <https://jira.hpdd.intel.com/> , along "
00167                        "with any interesting messages leading up to this point "
00168                        "(like SCSI errors, perhaps).  Because bi_private is "
00169                        "NULL, I can't wake up the thread that initiated this "
00170                        "IO - you will probably have to reboot this node.\n");
00171                 CERROR("bi_next: %p, bi_flags: %lx, bi_rw: %lu, bi_vcnt: %d, "
00172                        "bi_idx: %d, bi->size: %d, bi_end_io: %p, bi_cnt: %d, "
00173                        "bi_private: %p\n", bio->bi_next, bio->bi_flags,
00174                         bio->bi_rw, bio->bi_vcnt, bio_idx(bio),
00175                         bio_sectors(bio) << 9, bio->bi_end_io,
00176                         atomic_read(&bio->bi_cnt), bio->bi_private);
00177                 return;
00178         }
00179 
00180         /* the check is outside of the cycle for performance reason -bzzz */
00181         if (!test_bit(__REQ_WRITE, &bio->bi_rw)) {
00182                 bio_for_each_segment(bvl, bio, iter) {
00183                         if (likely(error == 0))
00184                                 SetPageUptodate(bvl_to_page(bvl));
00185                         LASSERT(PageLocked(bvl_to_page(bvl)));
00186                 }
00187                 atomic_dec(&iobuf->dr_dev->od_r_in_flight);
00188         } else {
00189                 atomic_dec(&iobuf->dr_dev->od_w_in_flight);
00190         }
00191 
00192         /* any real error is good enough -bzzz */
00193         if (error != 0 && iobuf->dr_error == 0)
00194                 iobuf->dr_error = error;
00195 
00196         /*
00197          * set dr_elapsed before dr_numreqs turns to 0, otherwise
00198          * it's possible that service thread will see dr_numreqs
00199          * is zero, but dr_elapsed is not set yet, leading to lost
00200          * data in this processing and an assertion in a subsequent
00201          * call to OSD.
00202          */
00203         if (atomic_read(&iobuf->dr_numreqs) == 1) {
00204                 iobuf->dr_elapsed = jiffies - iobuf->dr_start_time;
00205                 iobuf->dr_elapsed_valid = 1;
00206         }
00207         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&iobuf->dr_numreqs))
00208                 wake_up(&iobuf->dr_wait);
00209 
00210         /* Completed bios used to be chained off iobuf->dr_bios and freed in
00211          * filter_clear_dreq().  It was then possible to exhaust the biovec-256
00212          * mempool when serious on-disk fragmentation was encountered,
00213          * deadlocking the OST.  The bios are now released as soon as complete
00214          * so the pool cannot be exhausted while IOs are competing. bug 10076 */
00215         bio_put(bio);
00216 }
00217 
00218 static void record_start_io(struct osd_iobuf *iobuf, int size)
00219 {
00220         struct osd_device    *osd = iobuf->dr_dev;
00221         struct obd_histogram *h = osd->od_brw_stats.hist;
00222 
00223         iobuf->dr_frags++;
00224         atomic_inc(&iobuf->dr_numreqs);
00225 
00226         if (iobuf->dr_rw == 0) {
00227                 atomic_inc(&osd->od_r_in_flight);
00228                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_R_RPC_HIST],
00229                                  atomic_read(&osd->od_r_in_flight));
00230                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_R_DISK_IOSIZE], size);
00231         } else if (iobuf->dr_rw == 1) {
00232                 atomic_inc(&osd->od_w_in_flight);
00233                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_W_RPC_HIST],
00234                                  atomic_read(&osd->od_w_in_flight));
00235                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_W_DISK_IOSIZE], size);
00236         } else {
00237                 LBUG();
00238         }
00239 }
00240 
00241 static void osd_submit_bio(int rw, struct bio *bio)
00242 {
00243         LASSERTF(rw == 0 || rw == 1, "%x\n", rw);
00244         if (rw == 0)
00245                 submit_bio(READ, bio);
00246         else
00247                 submit_bio(WRITE, bio);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static int can_be_merged(struct bio *bio, sector_t sector)
00251 {
00252         if (bio == NULL)
00253                 return 0;
00254 
00255         return bio_end_sector(bio) == sector ? 1 : 0;
00256 }
00257 
00258 static int osd_do_bio(struct osd_device *osd, struct inode *inode,
00259                       struct osd_iobuf *iobuf)
00260 {
00261         int            blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00262         struct page  **pages = iobuf->dr_pages;
00263         int            npages = iobuf->dr_npages;
00264         sector_t      *blocks = iobuf->dr_blocks;
00265         int            total_blocks = npages * blocks_per_page;
00266         int            sector_bits = inode->i_sb->s_blocksize_bits - 9;
00267         unsigned int   blocksize = inode->i_sb->s_blocksize;
00268         struct bio    *bio = NULL;
00269         struct page   *page;
00270         unsigned int   page_offset;
00271         sector_t       sector;
00272         int            nblocks;
00273         int            block_idx;
00274         int            page_idx;
00275         int            i;
00276         int            rc = 0;
00277         ENTRY;
00278 
00279         LASSERT(iobuf->dr_npages == npages);
00280 
00281         osd_brw_stats_update(osd, iobuf);
00282         iobuf->dr_start_time = cfs_time_current();
00283 
00284         for (page_idx = 0, block_idx = 0;
00285              page_idx < npages;
00286              page_idx++, block_idx += blocks_per_page) {
00287 
00288                 page = pages[page_idx];
00289                 LASSERT(block_idx + blocks_per_page <= total_blocks);
00290 
00291                 for (i = 0, page_offset = 0;
00292                      i < blocks_per_page;
00293                      i += nblocks, page_offset += blocksize * nblocks) {
00294 
00295                         nblocks = 1;
00296 
00297                         if (blocks[block_idx + i] == 0) {  /* hole */
00298                                 LASSERTF(iobuf->dr_rw == 0,
00299                                          "page_idx %u, block_idx %u, i %u\n",
00300                                          page_idx, block_idx, i);
00301                                 memset(kmap(page) + page_offset, 0, blocksize);
00302                                 kunmap(page);
00303                                 continue;
00304                         }
00305 
00306                         sector = (sector_t)blocks[block_idx + i] << sector_bits;
00307 
00308                         /* Additional contiguous file blocks? */
00309                         while (i + nblocks < blocks_per_page &&
00310                                (sector + (nblocks << sector_bits)) ==
00311                                ((sector_t)blocks[block_idx + i + nblocks] <<
00312                                 sector_bits))
00313                                 nblocks++;
00314 
00315                         if (bio != NULL &&
00316                             can_be_merged(bio, sector) &&
00317                             bio_add_page(bio, page,
00318                                          blocksize * nblocks, page_offset) != 0)
00319                                 continue;       /* added this frag OK */
00320 
00321                         if (bio != NULL) {
00322                                 struct request_queue *q =
00323                                         bdev_get_queue(bio->bi_bdev);
00324                                 unsigned int bi_size = bio_sectors(bio) << 9;
00325 
00326                                 /* Dang! I have to fragment this I/O */
00327                                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "bio++ sz %d vcnt %d(%d) "
00328                                        "sectors %d(%d) psg %d(%d) hsg %d(%d)\n",
00329                                        bi_size, bio->bi_vcnt, bio->bi_max_vecs,
00330                                        bio_sectors(bio),
00331                                        queue_max_sectors(q),
00332                                        bio_phys_segments(q, bio),
00333                                        queue_max_phys_segments(q),
00334                                        0, queue_max_hw_segments(q));
00335                                 record_start_io(iobuf, bi_size);
00336                                 osd_submit_bio(iobuf->dr_rw, bio);
00337                         }
00338 
00339                         /* allocate new bio */
00340                         bio = bio_alloc(GFP_NOIO, min(BIO_MAX_PAGES,
00341                                                       (npages - page_idx) *
00342                                                       blocks_per_page));
00343                         if (bio == NULL) {
00344                                 CERROR("Can't allocate bio %u*%u = %u pages\n",
00345                                        (npages - page_idx), blocks_per_page,
00346                                        (npages - page_idx) * blocks_per_page);
00347                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00348                                 goto out;
00349                         }
00350 
00351                         bio->bi_bdev = inode->i_sb->s_bdev;
00352                         bio_set_sector(bio, sector);
00353                         bio->bi_rw = (iobuf->dr_rw == 0) ? READ : WRITE;
00354                         bio->bi_end_io = dio_complete_routine;
00355                         bio->bi_private = iobuf;
00356 
00357                         rc = bio_add_page(bio, page,
00358                                           blocksize * nblocks, page_offset);
00359                         LASSERT(rc != 0);
00360                 }
00361         }
00362 
00363         if (bio != NULL) {
00364                 record_start_io(iobuf, bio_sectors(bio) << 9);
00365                 osd_submit_bio(iobuf->dr_rw, bio);
00366                 rc = 0;
00367         }
00368 
00369 out:
00370         /* in order to achieve better IO throughput, we don't wait for writes
00371          * completion here. instead we proceed with transaction commit in
00372          * parallel and wait for IO completion once transaction is stopped
00373          * see osd_trans_stop() for more details -bzzz */
00374         if (iobuf->dr_rw == 0) {
00375                 wait_event(iobuf->dr_wait,
00376                            atomic_read(&iobuf->dr_numreqs) == 0);
00377                 osd_fini_iobuf(osd, iobuf);
00378         }
00379 
00380         if (rc == 0)
00381                 rc = iobuf->dr_error;
00382         RETURN(rc);
00383 }
00384 
00385 static int osd_map_remote_to_local(loff_t offset, ssize_t len, int *nrpages,
00386                                    struct niobuf_local *lnb)
00387 {
00388         ENTRY;
00389 
00390         *nrpages = 0;
00391 
00392         while (len > 0) {
00393                 int poff = offset & (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1);
00394                 int plen = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - poff;
00395 
00396                 if (plen > len)
00397                         plen = len;
00398                 lnb->lnb_file_offset = offset;
00399                 lnb->lnb_page_offset = poff;
00400                 lnb->lnb_len = plen;
00401                 /* lnb->lnb_flags = rnb->rnb_flags; */
00402                 lnb->lnb_flags = 0;
00403                 lnb->lnb_page = NULL;
00404                 lnb->lnb_rc = 0;
00405 
00406                 LASSERTF(plen <= len, "plen %u, len %lld\n", plen,
00407                          (long long) len);
00408                 offset += plen;
00409                 len -= plen;
00410                 lnb++;
00411                 (*nrpages)++;
00412         }
00413 
00414         RETURN(0);
00415 }
00416 
00417 static struct page *osd_get_page(struct dt_object *dt, loff_t offset, int rw)
00418 {
00419         struct inode      *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
00420         struct osd_device *d = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
00421         struct page       *page;
00422 
00423         LASSERT(inode);
00424 
00425         page = find_or_create_page(inode->i_mapping, offset >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00426                                    GFP_NOFS | __GFP_HIGHMEM);
00427         if (unlikely(page == NULL))
00428                 lprocfs_counter_add(d->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_NO_PAGE, 1);
00429 
00430         return page;
00431 }
00432 
00433 /*
00434  * there are following "locks":
00435  * journal_start
00436  * i_mutex
00437  * page lock
00438  *
00439  * osd write path:
00440  *  - lock page(s)
00441  *  - journal_start
00442  *  - truncate_sem
00443  *
00444  * ext4 vmtruncate:
00445  *  - lock pages, unlock
00446  *  - journal_start
00447  *  - lock partial page
00448  *  - i_data_sem
00449  *
00450  */
00451 
00464 static int osd_bufs_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00465                         struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
00466 {
00467         int i;
00468 
00469         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00470                 if (lnb[i].lnb_page == NULL)
00471                         continue;
00472                 LASSERT(PageLocked(lnb[i].lnb_page));
00473                 unlock_page(lnb[i].lnb_page);
00474                 page_cache_release(lnb[i].lnb_page);
00475                 lu_object_put(env, &dt->do_lu);
00476                 lnb[i].lnb_page = NULL;
00477         }
00478 
00479         RETURN(0);
00480 }
00481 
00506 static int osd_bufs_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00507                         loff_t pos, ssize_t len, struct niobuf_local *lnb,
00508                         int rw)
00509 {
00510         struct osd_object   *obj    = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00511         int npages, i, rc = 0;
00512 
00513         LASSERT(obj->oo_inode);
00514 
00515         osd_map_remote_to_local(pos, len, &npages, lnb);
00516 
00517         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++, lnb++) {
00518                 lnb->lnb_page = osd_get_page(dt, lnb->lnb_file_offset, rw);
00519                 if (lnb->lnb_page == NULL)
00520                         GOTO(cleanup, rc = -ENOMEM);
00521 
00522                 wait_on_page_writeback(lnb->lnb_page);
00523                 BUG_ON(PageWriteback(lnb->lnb_page));
00524 
00525                 lu_object_get(&dt->do_lu);
00526         }
00527 
00528         RETURN(i);
00529 
00530 cleanup:
00531         if (i > 0)
00532                 osd_bufs_put(env, dt, lnb - i, i);
00533         return rc;
00534 }

00536 #ifndef HAVE_LDISKFS_MAP_BLOCKS

00539 #define ldiskfs_ext_pblock(ex) ext_pblock((ex))
00540 #endif

00542 struct bpointers {
00543         sector_t *blocks;
00544         unsigned long start;
00545         int num;
00546         int init_num;
00547         int create;
00548 };
00549 
00550 static long ldiskfs_ext_find_goal(struct inode *inode,
00551                                   struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path,
00552                                   unsigned long block, int *aflags)
00553 {
00554         struct ldiskfs_inode_info *ei = LDISKFS_I(inode);
00555         unsigned long bg_start;
00556         unsigned long colour;
00557         int depth;
00558 
00559         if (path) {
00560                 struct ldiskfs_extent *ex;
00561                 depth = path->p_depth;
00562 
00563                 /* try to predict block placement */
00564                 if ((ex = path[depth].p_ext))
00565                         return ldiskfs_ext_pblock(ex) +
00566                                 (block - le32_to_cpu(ex->ee_block));
00567 
00568                 /* it looks index is empty
00569                  * try to find starting from index itself */
00570                 if (path[depth].p_bh)
00571                         return path[depth].p_bh->b_blocknr;
00572         }
00573 
00574         /* OK. use inode's group */
00575         bg_start = (ei->i_block_group * LDISKFS_BLOCKS_PER_GROUP(inode->i_sb)) +
00576                 le32_to_cpu(LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_first_data_block);
00577         colour = (current->pid % 16) *
00578                 (LDISKFS_BLOCKS_PER_GROUP(inode->i_sb) / 16);
00579         return bg_start + colour + block;
00580 }
00581 
00582 static unsigned long new_blocks(handle_t *handle, struct inode *inode,
00583                                 struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path,
00584                                 unsigned long block, unsigned long *count,
00585                                 int *err)
00586 {
00587         struct ldiskfs_allocation_request ar;
00588         unsigned long pblock;
00589         int aflags;
00590 
00591         /* find neighbour allocated blocks */
00592         ar.lleft = block;
00593         *err = ldiskfs_ext_search_left(inode, path, &ar.lleft, &ar.pleft);
00594         if (*err)
00595                 return 0;
00596         ar.lright = block;
00597         *err = ldiskfs_ext_search_right(inode, path, &ar.lright, &ar.pright);
00598         if (*err)
00599                 return 0;
00600 
00601         /* allocate new block */
00602         ar.goal = ldiskfs_ext_find_goal(inode, path, block, &aflags);
00603         ar.inode = inode;
00604         ar.logical = block;
00605         ar.len = *count;
00606         ar.flags = LDISKFS_MB_HINT_DATA;
00607         pblock = ldiskfs_mb_new_blocks(handle, &ar, err);
00608         *count = ar.len;
00609         return pblock;
00610 }
00611 
00612 static int ldiskfs_ext_new_extent_cb(struct inode *inode,
00613                                      struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path,
00614                                      struct ldiskfs_ext_cache *cex,
00615 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_PREPARE_CB_EXTENT
00616                                      struct ldiskfs_extent *ex,
00617 #endif
00618                                      void *cbdata)
00619 {
00620         struct bpointers *bp = cbdata;
00621         struct ldiskfs_extent nex;
00622         unsigned long pblock = 0;
00623         unsigned long tgen;
00624         int err, i;
00625         unsigned long count;
00626         handle_t *handle;
00627 
00628 #ifdef LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT /* until kernel 2.6.37 */
00629         if (cex->ec_type == LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT) {
00630 #else
00631         if ((cex->ec_len != 0) && (cex->ec_start != 0)) {
00632 #endif
00633                 err = EXT_CONTINUE;
00634                 goto map;
00635         }
00636 
00637         if (bp->create == 0) {
00638                 i = 0;
00639                 if (cex->ec_block < bp->start)
00640                         i = bp->start - cex->ec_block;
00641                 if (i >= cex->ec_len)
00642                         CERROR("nothing to do?! i = %d, e_num = %u\n",
00643                                         i, cex->ec_len);
00644                 for (; i < cex->ec_len && bp->num; i++) {
00645                         *(bp->blocks) = 0;
00646                         bp->blocks++;
00647                         bp->num--;
00648                         bp->start++;
00649                 }
00650 
00651                 return EXT_CONTINUE;
00652         }
00653 
00654         tgen = LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_ext_generation;
00655         count = ldiskfs_ext_calc_credits_for_insert(inode, path);
00656 
00657         handle = osd_journal_start(inode, LDISKFS_HT_MISC,
00658                                    count + LDISKFS_ALLOC_NEEDED + 1);
00659         if (IS_ERR(handle)) {
00660                 return PTR_ERR(handle);
00661         }
00662 
00663         if (tgen != LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_ext_generation) {
00664                 /* the tree has changed. so path can be invalid at moment */
00665                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00666                 return EXT_REPEAT;
00667         }
00668 
00669         /* In 2.6.32 kernel, ldiskfs_ext_walk_space()'s callback func is not
00670          * protected by i_data_sem as whole. so we patch it to store
00671          * generation to path and now verify the tree hasn't changed */
00672         down_write((&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem));
00673 
00674         /* validate extent, make sure the extent tree does not changed */
00675         if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_ext_generation != path[0].p_generation) {
00676                 /* cex is invalid, try again */
00677                 up_write(&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem);
00678                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00679                 return EXT_REPEAT;
00680         }
00681 
00682         count = cex->ec_len;
00683         pblock = new_blocks(handle, inode, path, cex->ec_block, &count, &err);
00684         if (!pblock)
00685                 goto out;
00686         BUG_ON(count > cex->ec_len);
00687 
00688         /* insert new extent */
00689         nex.ee_block = cpu_to_le32(cex->ec_block);
00690         ldiskfs_ext_store_pblock(&nex, pblock);
00691         nex.ee_len = cpu_to_le16(count);
00692         err = ldiskfs_ext_insert_extent(handle, inode, path, &nex, 0);
00693         if (err) {
00694                 /* free data blocks we just allocated */
00695                 /* not a good idea to call discard here directly,
00696                  * but otherwise we'd need to call it every free() */
00697                 ldiskfs_discard_preallocations(inode);
00698 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_FREE_BLOCK_WITH_BUFFER_HEAD /* Introduced in 2.6.32-rc7 */
00699                 ldiskfs_free_blocks(handle, inode, NULL,
00700                                     ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex),
00701                                     le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len), 0);
00702 #else
00703                 ldiskfs_free_blocks(handle, inode, ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex),
00704                                     le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len), 0);
00705 #endif
00706                 goto out;
00707         }
00708 
00709         /*
00710          * Putting len of the actual extent we just inserted,
00711          * we are asking ldiskfs_ext_walk_space() to continue
00712          * scaning after that block
00713          */
00714         cex->ec_len = le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len);
00715         cex->ec_start = ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex);
00716         BUG_ON(le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len) == 0);
00717         BUG_ON(le32_to_cpu(nex.ee_block) != cex->ec_block);
00718 
00719 out:
00720         up_write((&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem));
00721         ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00722 map:
00723         if (err >= 0) {
00724                 /* map blocks */
00725                 if (bp->num == 0) {
00726                         CERROR("hmm. why do we find this extent?\n");
00727                         CERROR("initial space: %lu:%u\n",
00728                                 bp->start, bp->init_num);
00729 #ifdef LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT /* until kernel 2.6.37 */
00730                         CERROR("current extent: %u/%u/%llu %d\n",
00731                                 cex->ec_block, cex->ec_len,
00732                                 (unsigned long long)cex->ec_start,
00733                                 cex->ec_type);
00734 #else
00735                         CERROR("current extent: %u/%u/%llu\n",
00736                                 cex->ec_block, cex->ec_len,
00737                                 (unsigned long long)cex->ec_start);
00738 #endif
00739                 }
00740                 i = 0;
00741                 if (cex->ec_block < bp->start)
00742                         i = bp->start - cex->ec_block;
00743                 if (i >= cex->ec_len)
00744                         CERROR("nothing to do?! i = %d, e_num = %u\n",
00745                                         i, cex->ec_len);
00746                 for (; i < cex->ec_len && bp->num; i++) {
00747                         *(bp->blocks) = cex->ec_start + i;
00748                         if (pblock != 0) {
00749                                 /* unmap any possible underlying metadata from
00750                                  * the block device mapping.  bug 6998. */
00751                                 unmap_underlying_metadata(inode->i_sb->s_bdev,
00752                                                           *(bp->blocks));
00753                         }
00754                         bp->blocks++;
00755                         bp->num--;
00756                         bp->start++;
00757                 }
00758         }
00759         return err;
00760 }
00761 
00762 static int osd_ldiskfs_map_nblocks(struct inode *inode, unsigned long index,
00763                                    int clen, sector_t *blocks, int create)
00764 {
00765         int blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00766         struct bpointers bp;
00767         int err;
00768 
00769         if (index + clen >= inode->i_sb->s_maxbytes >> PAGE_SHIFT)
00770                 return -EFBIG;
00771 
00772         bp.blocks = blocks;
00773         bp.start = index * blocks_per_page;
00774         bp.init_num = bp.num = clen * blocks_per_page;
00775         bp.create = create;
00776 
00777         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "blocks %lu-%lu requested for inode %u\n",
00778                bp.start, bp.start + bp.num - 1, (unsigned)inode->i_ino);
00779 
00780         err = ldiskfs_ext_walk_space(inode, bp.start, bp.num,
00781                                      ldiskfs_ext_new_extent_cb, &bp);
00782         ldiskfs_ext_invalidate_cache(inode);
00783 
00784         return err;
00785 }
00786 
00787 static int osd_ldiskfs_map_bm_inode_pages(struct inode *inode,
00788                                           struct page **page, int pages,
00789                                           sector_t *blocks, int create)
00790 {
00791         int blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00792         pgoff_t bitmap_max_page_index;
00793         sector_t *b;
00794         int rc = 0, i;
00795 
00796         bitmap_max_page_index = LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_bitmap_maxbytes >>
00797                                 PAGE_SHIFT;
00798         for (i = 0, b = blocks; i < pages; i++, page++) {
00799                 if ((*page)->index + 1 >= bitmap_max_page_index) {
00800                         rc = -EFBIG;
00801                         break;
00802                 }
00803                 rc = ldiskfs_map_inode_page(inode, *page, b, create);
00804                 if (rc) {
00805                         CERROR("ino %lu, blk %llu create %d: rc %d\n",
00806                                inode->i_ino,
00807                                (unsigned long long)*b, create, rc);
00808                         break;
00809                 }
00810                 b += blocks_per_page;
00811         }
00812         return rc;
00813 }
00814 
00815 static int osd_ldiskfs_map_ext_inode_pages(struct inode *inode,
00816                                            struct page **page,
00817                                            int pages, sector_t *blocks,
00818                                            int create)
00819 {
00820         int rc = 0, i = 0, clen = 0;
00821         struct page *fp = NULL;
00822 
00823         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "inode %lu: map %d pages from %lu\n",
00824                 inode->i_ino, pages, (*page)->index);
00825 
00826         /* pages are sorted already. so, we just have to find
00827          * contig. space and process them properly */
00828         while (i < pages) {
00829                 if (fp == NULL) {
00830                         /* start new extent */
00831                         fp = *page++;
00832                         clen = 1;
00833                         i++;
00834                         continue;
00835                 } else if (fp->index + clen == (*page)->index) {
00836                         /* continue the extent */
00837                         page++;
00838                         clen++;
00839                         i++;
00840                         continue;
00841                 }
00842 
00843                 /* process found extent */
00844                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_nblocks(inode, fp->index, clen,
00845                                              blocks, create);
00846                 if (rc)
00847                         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00848 
00849                 /* look for next extent */
00850                 fp = NULL;
00851                 blocks += clen * (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits);
00852         }
00853 
00854         if (fp)
00855                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_nblocks(inode, fp->index, clen,
00856                                              blocks, create);
00857 
00858 cleanup:
00859         return rc;
00860 }
00861 
00862 static int osd_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(struct inode *inode, struct page **page,
00863                                        int pages, sector_t *blocks,
00864                                        int create)
00865 {
00866         int rc;
00867 
00868         if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_flags & LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL) {
00869                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_ext_inode_pages(inode, page, pages,
00870                                                      blocks, create);
00871                 return rc;
00872         }
00873         rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_bm_inode_pages(inode, page, pages, blocks, create);
00874 
00875         return rc;
00876 }
00877 #else
00878 static int osd_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(struct inode *inode, struct page **page,
00879                                        int pages, sector_t *blocks,
00880                                        int create)
00881 {
00882         int blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00883         int rc = 0, i = 0;
00884         struct page *fp = NULL;
00885         int clen = 0;
00886         pgoff_t max_page_index;
00887 
00888         max_page_index = inode->i_sb->s_maxbytes >> PAGE_SHIFT;
00889 
00890         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "inode %lu: map %d pages from %lu\n",
00891                 inode->i_ino, pages, (*page)->index);
00892 
00893         /* pages are sorted already. so, we just have to find
00894          * contig. space and process them properly */
00895         while (i < pages) {
00896                 long blen, total = 0;
00897                 handle_t *handle = NULL;
00898                 struct ldiskfs_map_blocks map = { 0 };
00899 
00900                 if (fp == NULL) { /* start new extent */
00901                         fp = *page++;
00902                         clen = 1;
00903                         if (++i != pages)
00904                                 continue;
00905                 } else if (fp->index + clen == (*page)->index) {
00906                         /* continue the extent */
00907                         page++;
00908                         clen++;
00909                         if (++i != pages)
00910                                 continue;
00911                 }
00912                 if (fp->index + clen >= max_page_index)
00913                         GOTO(cleanup, rc = -EFBIG);
00914                 /* process found extent */
00915                 map.m_lblk = fp->index * blocks_per_page;
00916                 map.m_len = blen = clen * blocks_per_page;
00917                 if (create) {
00918                         create = LDISKFS_GET_BLOCKS_CREATE;
00919                         handle = ldiskfs_journal_current_handle();
00920                         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
00921                 }
00922 cont_map:
00923                 rc = ldiskfs_map_blocks(handle, inode, &map, create);
00924                 if (rc >= 0) {
00925                         int c = 0;
00926                         for (; total < blen && c < map.m_len; c++, total++) {
00927                                 if (rc == 0) {
00928                                         *(blocks + total) = 0;
00929                                         total++;
00930                                         break;
00931                                 } else {
00932                                         *(blocks + total) = map.m_pblk + c;
00933                                         /* unmap any possible underlying
00934                                          * metadata from the block device
00935                                          * mapping.  bug 6998. */
00936                                         if ((map.m_flags & LDISKFS_MAP_NEW) &&
00937                                             create)
00938                                                 unmap_underlying_metadata(
00939                                                         inode->i_sb->s_bdev,
00940                                                         map.m_pblk + c);
00941                                 }
00942                         }
00943                         rc = 0;
00944                 }
00945                 if (rc == 0 && total < blen) {
00946                         map.m_lblk = fp->index * blocks_per_page + total;
00947                         map.m_len = blen - total;
00948                         goto cont_map;
00949                 }
00950                 if (rc != 0)
00951                         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00952 
00953                 /* look for next extent */
00954                 fp = NULL;
00955                 blocks += blocks_per_page * clen;
00956         }
00957 cleanup:
00958         return rc;
00959 }
00960 #endif /* HAVE_LDISKFS_MAP_BLOCKS */
00961 
00962 static int osd_write_prep(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00963                           struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
00964 {
00965         struct osd_thread_info *oti   = osd_oti_get(env);
00966         struct osd_iobuf       *iobuf = &oti->oti_iobuf;
00967         struct inode           *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
00968         struct osd_device      *osd   = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
00969         struct timeval          start;
00970         struct timeval          end;
00971         unsigned long           timediff;
00972         ssize_t                 isize;
00973         __s64                   maxidx;
00974         int                     rc = 0;
00975         int                     i;
00976         int                     cache = 0;
00977 
00978         LASSERT(inode);
00979 
00980         rc = osd_init_iobuf(osd, iobuf, 0, npages);
00981         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00982                 RETURN(rc);
00983 
00984         isize = i_size_read(inode);
00985         maxidx = ((isize + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) - 1;
00986 
00987         if (osd->od_writethrough_cache)
00988                 cache = 1;
00989         if (isize > osd->od_readcache_max_filesize)
00990                 cache = 0;
00991 
00992         do_gettimeofday(&start);
00993         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00994 
00995                 if (cache == 0)
00996                         generic_error_remove_page(inode->i_mapping,
00997                                                   lnb[i].lnb_page);
00998 
00999                 /*
01000                  * till commit the content of the page is undefined
01001                  * we'll set it uptodate once bulk is done. otherwise
01002                  * subsequent reads can access non-stable data
01003                  */
01004                 ClearPageUptodate(lnb[i].lnb_page);
01005 
01006                 if (lnb[i].lnb_len == PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)
01007                         continue;
01008 
01009                 if (maxidx >= lnb[i].lnb_page->index) {
01010                         osd_iobuf_add_page(iobuf, lnb[i].lnb_page);
01011                 } else {
01012                         long off;
01013                         char *p = kmap(lnb[i].lnb_page);
01014 
01015                         off = lnb[i].lnb_page_offset;
01016                         if (off)
01017                                 memset(p, 0, off);
01018                         off = (lnb[i].lnb_page_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len) &
01019                               ~PAGE_MASK;
01020                         if (off)
01021                                 memset(p + off, 0, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - off);
01022                         kunmap(lnb[i].lnb_page);
01023                 }
01024         }
01025         do_gettimeofday(&end);
01026         timediff = cfs_timeval_sub(&end, &start, NULL);
01027         lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_GET_PAGE, timediff);
01028 
01029         if (iobuf->dr_npages) {
01030                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(inode, iobuf->dr_pages,
01031                                                  iobuf->dr_npages,
01032                                                  iobuf->dr_blocks, 0);
01033                 if (likely(rc == 0)) {
01034                         rc = osd_do_bio(osd, inode, iobuf);
01035                         /* do IO stats for preparation reads */
01036                         osd_fini_iobuf(osd, iobuf);
01037                 }
01038         }
01039         RETURN(rc);
01040 }
01041 
01042 struct osd_fextent {
01043         sector_t        start;
01044         sector_t        end;
01045         unsigned int    mapped:1;
01046 };
01047 
01048 static int osd_is_mapped(struct dt_object *dt, __u64 offset,
01049                          struct osd_fextent *cached_extent)
01050 {
01051         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01052         sector_t block = offset >> inode->i_blkbits;
01053         sector_t start;
01054         struct fiemap_extent_info fei = { 0 };
01055         struct fiemap_extent fe = { 0 };
01056         mm_segment_t saved_fs;
01057         int rc;
01058 
01059         if (block >= cached_extent->start && block < cached_extent->end)
01060                 return cached_extent->mapped;
01061 
01062         if (i_size_read(inode) == 0)
01063                 return 0;
01064 
01065         /* Beyond EOF, must not be mapped */
01066         if (((i_size_read(inode) - 1) >> inode->i_blkbits) < block)
01067                 return 0;
01068 
01069         fei.fi_extents_max = 1;
01070         fei.fi_extents_start = &fe;
01071 
01072         saved_fs = get_fs();
01073         set_fs(get_ds());
01074         rc = inode->i_op->fiemap(inode, &fei, offset, FIEMAP_MAX_OFFSET-offset);
01075         set_fs(saved_fs);
01076         if (rc != 0)
01077                 return 0;
01078 
01079         start = fe.fe_logical >> inode->i_blkbits;
01080 
01081         if (start > block) {
01082                 cached_extent->start = block;
01083                 cached_extent->end = start;
01084                 cached_extent->mapped = 0;
01085         } else {
01086                 cached_extent->start = start;
01087                 cached_extent->end = (fe.fe_logical + fe.fe_length) >>
01088                                       inode->i_blkbits;
01089                 cached_extent->mapped = 1;
01090         }
01091 
01092         return cached_extent->mapped;
01093 }
01094 
01095 static int osd_declare_write_commit(const struct lu_env *env,
01096                                     struct dt_object *dt,
01097                                     struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages,
01098                                     struct thandle *handle)
01099 {
01100         const struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
01101         struct inode            *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01102         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01103         int                      extents = 1;
01104         int                      depth;
01105         int                      i;
01106         int                      newblocks;
01107         int                      rc = 0;
01108         int                      flags = 0;
01109         int                      credits = 0;
01110         bool                     ignore_quota = false;
01111         long long                quota_space = 0;
01112         struct osd_fextent       extent = { 0 };
01113         ENTRY;
01114 
01115         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01116         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01117         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
01118 
01119         newblocks = npages;
01120 
01121         /* calculate number of extents (probably better to pass nb) */
01122         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01123                 if (i && lnb[i].lnb_file_offset !=
01124                     lnb[i - 1].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i - 1].lnb_len)
01125                         extents++;
01126 
01127                 if (!osd_is_mapped(dt, lnb[i].lnb_file_offset, &extent))
01128                         quota_space += PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01129 
01130                 /* ignore quota for the whole request if any page is from
01131                  * client cache or written by root.
01132                  *
01133                  * XXX once we drop the 1.8 client support, the checking
01134                  * for whether page is from cache can be simplified as:
01135                  * !(lnb[i].flags & OBD_BRW_SYNC)
01136                  *
01137                  * XXX we could handle this on per-lnb basis as done by
01138                  * grant. */
01139                 if ((lnb[i].lnb_flags & OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA) ||
01140                     (lnb[i].lnb_flags & (OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT | OBD_BRW_SYNC)) ==
01141                     OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT)
01142                         ignore_quota = true;
01143         }
01144 
01145         /*
01146          * each extent can go into new leaf causing a split
01147          * 5 is max tree depth: inode + 4 index blocks
01148          * with blockmaps, depth is 3 at most
01149          */
01150         if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_flags & LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL) {
01151                 /*
01152                  * many concurrent threads may grow tree by the time
01153                  * our transaction starts. so, consider 2 is a min depth
01154                  */
01155                 depth = ext_depth(inode);
01156                 depth = max(depth, 1) + 1;
01157                 newblocks += depth;
01158                 credits++; /* inode */
01159                 credits += depth * 2 * extents;
01160         } else {
01161                 depth = 3;
01162                 newblocks += depth;
01163                 credits++; /* inode */
01164                 credits += depth * extents;
01165         }
01166 
01167         /* quota space for metadata blocks */
01168         quota_space += depth * extents * LDISKFS_BLOCK_SIZE(osd_sb(osd));
01169 
01170         /* quota space should be reported in 1K blocks */
01171         quota_space = toqb(quota_space);
01172 
01173         /* each new block can go in different group (bitmap + gd) */
01174 
01175         /* we can't dirty more bitmap blocks than exist */
01176         if (newblocks > LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(osd))->s_groups_count)
01177                 credits += LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(osd))->s_groups_count;
01178         else
01179                 credits += newblocks;
01180 
01181         /* we can't dirty more gd blocks than exist */
01182         if (newblocks > LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(osd))->s_gdb_count)
01183                 credits += LDISKFS_SB(osd_sb(osd))->s_gdb_count;
01184         else
01185                 credits += newblocks;
01186 
01187         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_WRITE, credits);
01188 
01189         /* make sure the over quota flags were not set */
01190         lnb[0].lnb_flags &= ~(OBD_BRW_OVER_USRQUOTA | OBD_BRW_OVER_GRPQUOTA);
01191 
01192         rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, i_uid_read(inode), i_gid_read(inode),
01193                                    quota_space, oh, osd_dt_obj(dt), true,
01194                                    &flags, ignore_quota);
01195 
01196         /* we need only to store the overquota flags in the first lnb for
01197          * now, once we support multiple objects BRW, this code needs be
01198          * revised. */
01199         if (flags & QUOTA_FL_OVER_USRQUOTA)
01200                 lnb[0].lnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_OVER_USRQUOTA;
01201         if (flags & QUOTA_FL_OVER_GRPQUOTA)
01202                 lnb[0].lnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_OVER_GRPQUOTA;
01203 
01204         RETURN(rc);
01205 }
01206 
01207 /* Check if a block is allocated or not */
01208 static int osd_write_commit(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01209                             struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages,
01210                             struct thandle *thandle)
01211 {
01212         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01213         struct osd_iobuf *iobuf = &oti->oti_iobuf;
01214         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01215         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
01216         loff_t isize;
01217         int rc = 0, i;
01218         struct osd_fextent extent = { 0 };
01219 
01220         LASSERT(inode);
01221 
01222         rc = osd_init_iobuf(osd, iobuf, 1, npages);
01223         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01224                 RETURN(rc);
01225 
01226         isize = i_size_read(inode);
01227         ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
01228 
01229         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01230                 if (lnb[i].lnb_rc == -ENOSPC &&
01231                     osd_is_mapped(dt, lnb[i].lnb_file_offset, &extent)) {
01232                         /* Allow the write to proceed if overwriting an
01233                          * existing block */
01234                         lnb[i].lnb_rc = 0;
01235                 }
01236 
01237                 if (lnb[i].lnb_rc) { /* ENOSPC, network RPC error, etc. */
01238                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Skipping [%d] == %d\n", i,
01239                                lnb[i].lnb_rc);
01240                         LASSERT(lnb[i].lnb_page);
01241                         generic_error_remove_page(inode->i_mapping,
01242                                                   lnb[i].lnb_page);
01243                         continue;
01244                 }
01245 
01246                 LASSERT(PageLocked(lnb[i].lnb_page));
01247                 LASSERT(!PageWriteback(lnb[i].lnb_page));
01248 
01249                 if (lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len > isize)
01250                         isize = lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len;
01251 
01252                 /*
01253                  * Since write and truncate are serialized by oo_sem, even
01254                  * partial-page truncate should not leave dirty pages in the
01255                  * page cache.
01256                  */
01257                 LASSERT(!PageDirty(lnb[i].lnb_page));
01258 
01259                 SetPageUptodate(lnb[i].lnb_page);
01260 
01261                 osd_iobuf_add_page(iobuf, lnb[i].lnb_page);
01262         }
01263 
01264         osd_trans_exec_op(env, thandle, OSD_OT_WRITE);
01265 
01266         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OST_MAPBLK_ENOSPC)) {
01267                 rc = -ENOSPC;
01268         } else if (iobuf->dr_npages > 0) {
01269                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(inode, iobuf->dr_pages,
01270                                                  iobuf->dr_npages,
01271                                                  iobuf->dr_blocks, 1);
01272         } else {
01273                 /* no pages to write, no transno is needed */
01274                 thandle->th_local = 1;
01275         }
01276 
01277         if (likely(rc == 0)) {
01278                 if (isize > i_size_read(inode)) {
01279                         i_size_write(inode, isize);
01280                         LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_disksize = isize;
01281                         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
01282                 }
01283 
01284                 rc = osd_do_bio(osd, inode, iobuf);
01285                 /* we don't do stats here as in read path because
01286                  * write is async: we'll do this in osd_put_bufs() */
01287         } else {
01288                 osd_fini_iobuf(osd, iobuf);
01289         }
01290 
01291         osd_trans_exec_check(env, thandle, OSD_OT_WRITE);
01292 
01293         if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
01294                 /* if write fails, we should drop pages from the cache */
01295                 for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01296                         if (lnb[i].lnb_page == NULL)
01297                                 continue;
01298                         LASSERT(PageLocked(lnb[i].lnb_page));
01299                         generic_error_remove_page(inode->i_mapping,
01300                                                   lnb[i].lnb_page);
01301                 }
01302         }
01303 
01304         RETURN(rc);
01305 }
01306 
01307 static int osd_read_prep(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01308                          struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
01309 {
01310         struct osd_thread_info *oti = osd_oti_get(env);
01311         struct osd_iobuf *iobuf = &oti->oti_iobuf;
01312         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01313         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(osd_dt_obj(dt));
01314         struct timeval start, end;
01315         unsigned long timediff;
01316         int rc = 0, i, cache = 0, cache_hits = 0, cache_misses = 0;
01317         loff_t isize;
01318 
01319         LASSERT(inode);
01320 
01321         rc = osd_init_iobuf(osd, iobuf, 0, npages);
01322         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01323                 RETURN(rc);
01324 
01325         isize = i_size_read(inode);
01326 
01327         if (osd->od_read_cache)
01328                 cache = 1;
01329         if (isize > osd->od_readcache_max_filesize)
01330                 cache = 0;
01331 
01332         do_gettimeofday(&start);
01333         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01334 
01335                 if (isize <= lnb[i].lnb_file_offset)
01336                         /* If there's no more data, abort early.
01337                          * lnb->lnb_rc == 0, so it's easy to detect later. */
01338                         break;
01339 
01340                 if (isize < lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len)
01341                         lnb[i].lnb_rc = isize - lnb[i].lnb_file_offset;
01342                 else
01343                         lnb[i].lnb_rc = lnb[i].lnb_len;
01344 
01345                 if (PageUptodate(lnb[i].lnb_page)) {
01346                         cache_hits++;
01347                 } else {
01348                         cache_misses++;
01349                         osd_iobuf_add_page(iobuf, lnb[i].lnb_page);
01350                 }
01351 
01352                 if (cache == 0)
01353                         generic_error_remove_page(inode->i_mapping,
01354                                                   lnb[i].lnb_page);
01355         }
01356         do_gettimeofday(&end);
01357         timediff = cfs_timeval_sub(&end, &start, NULL);
01358         lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_GET_PAGE, timediff);
01359 
01360         if (cache_hits != 0)
01361                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_CACHE_HIT,
01362                                     cache_hits);
01363         if (cache_misses != 0)
01364                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_CACHE_MISS,
01365                                     cache_misses);
01366         if (cache_hits + cache_misses != 0)
01367                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats, LPROC_OSD_CACHE_ACCESS,
01368                                     cache_hits + cache_misses);
01369 
01370         if (iobuf->dr_npages) {
01371                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(inode, iobuf->dr_pages,
01372                                                  iobuf->dr_npages,
01373                                                  iobuf->dr_blocks, 0);
01374                 rc = osd_do_bio(osd, inode, iobuf);
01375 
01376                 /* IO stats will be done in osd_bufs_put() */
01377         }
01378 
01379         RETURN(rc);
01380 }
01381 
01382 /*
01383  * XXX: Another layering violation for now.
01384  *
01385  * We don't want to use ->f_op->read methods, because generic file write
01386  *
01387  *         - serializes on ->i_sem, and
01388  *
01389  *         - does a lot of extra work like balance_dirty_pages(),
01390  *
01391  * which doesn't work for globally shared files like /last_rcvd.
01392  */
01393 static int osd_ldiskfs_readlink(struct inode *inode, char *buffer, int buflen)
01394 {
01395         struct ldiskfs_inode_info *ei = LDISKFS_I(inode);
01396 
01397         memcpy(buffer, (char *)ei->i_data, buflen);
01398 
01399         return  buflen;
01400 }
01401 
01402 int osd_ldiskfs_read(struct inode *inode, void *buf, int size, loff_t *offs)
01403 {
01404         struct buffer_head *bh;
01405         unsigned long block;
01406         int osize;
01407         int blocksize;
01408         int csize;
01409         int boffs;
01410         int err = 0;
01411 
01412         /* prevent reading after eof */
01413         spin_lock(&inode->i_lock);
01414         if (i_size_read(inode) < *offs + size) {
01415                 loff_t diff = i_size_read(inode) - *offs;
01416                 spin_unlock(&inode->i_lock);
01417                 if (diff < 0) {
01418                         CDEBUG(D_EXT2, "size %llu is too short to read @%llu\n",
01419                                i_size_read(inode), *offs);
01420                         return -EBADR;
01421                 } else if (diff == 0) {
01422                         return 0;
01423                 } else {
01424                         size = diff;
01425                 }
01426         } else {
01427                 spin_unlock(&inode->i_lock);
01428         }
01429 
01430         blocksize = 1 << inode->i_blkbits;
01431         osize = size;
01432         while (size > 0) {
01433                 block = *offs >> inode->i_blkbits;
01434                 boffs = *offs & (blocksize - 1);
01435                 csize = min(blocksize - boffs, size);
01436                 bh = ldiskfs_bread(NULL, inode, block, 0, &err);
01437                 if (err != 0) {
01438                         CERROR("%s: can't read %u@%llu on ino %lu: rc = %d\n",
01439                                LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_volume_name,
01440                                csize, *offs, inode->i_ino, err);
01441                         if (bh != NULL)
01442                                 brelse(bh);
01443                         return err;
01444                 }
01445 
01446                 if (bh != NULL) {
01447                         memcpy(buf, bh->b_data + boffs, csize);
01448                         brelse(bh);
01449                 } else {
01450                         memset(buf, 0, csize);
01451                 }
01452 
01453                 *offs += csize;
01454                 buf += csize;
01455                 size -= csize;
01456         }
01457         return osize;
01458 }
01459 
01460 static ssize_t osd_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01461                         struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *pos)
01462 {
01463         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01464         int           rc;
01465 
01466         /* Read small symlink from inode body as we need to maintain correct
01467          * on-disk symlinks for ldiskfs.
01468          */
01469         if (S_ISLNK(dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr) &&
01470             (buf->lb_len < sizeof(LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data)))
01471                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_readlink(inode, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
01472         else
01473                 rc = osd_ldiskfs_read(inode, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len, pos);
01474 
01475         return rc;
01476 }
01477 
01478 static inline int osd_extents_enabled(struct super_block *sb,
01479                                       struct inode *inode)
01480 {
01481         if (inode != NULL) {
01482                 if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_flags & LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL)
01483                         return 1;
01484         } else if (LDISKFS_HAS_INCOMPAT_FEATURE(sb,
01485                                 LDISKFS_FEATURE_INCOMPAT_EXTENTS)) {
01486                 return 1;
01487         }
01488         return 0;
01489 }
01490 
01491 int osd_calc_bkmap_credits(struct super_block *sb, struct inode *inode,
01492                            const loff_t size, const loff_t pos,
01493                            const int blocks)
01494 {
01495         int credits, bits, bs, i;
01496 
01497         bits = sb->s_blocksize_bits;
01498         bs = 1 << bits;
01499 
01500         /* legacy blockmap: 3 levels * 3 (bitmap,gd,itself)
01501          * we do not expect blockmaps on the large files,
01502          * so let's shrink it to 2 levels (4GB files) */
01503 
01504         /* this is default reservation: 2 levels */
01505         credits = (blocks + 2) * 3;
01506 
01507         /* actual offset is unknown, hard to optimize */
01508         if (pos == -1)
01509                 return credits;
01510 
01511         /* now check for few specific cases to optimize */
01512         if (pos + size <= LDISKFS_NDIR_BLOCKS * bs) {
01513                 /* no indirects */
01514                 credits = blocks;
01515                 /* allocate if not allocated */
01516                 if (inode == NULL) {
01517                         credits += blocks * 2;
01518                         return credits;
01519                 }
01520                 for (i = (pos >> bits); i < (pos >> bits) + blocks; i++) {
01521                         LASSERT(i < LDISKFS_NDIR_BLOCKS);
01522                         if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data[i] == 0)
01523                                 credits += 2;
01524                 }
01525         } else if (pos + size <= (LDISKFS_NDIR_BLOCKS + 1024) * bs) {
01526                 /* single indirect */
01527                 credits = blocks * 3;
01528                 if (inode == NULL ||
01529                     LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data[LDISKFS_IND_BLOCK] == 0)
01530                         credits += 3;
01531                 else
01532                         /* The indirect block may be modified. */
01533                         credits += 1;
01534         }
01535 
01536         return credits;
01537 }
01538 
01539 static ssize_t osd_declare_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01540                                  const struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t _pos,
01541                                  struct thandle *handle)
01542 {
01543         struct osd_object  *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01544         struct inode       *inode = obj->oo_inode;
01545         struct super_block *sb = osd_sb(osd_obj2dev(obj));
01546         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01547         int                 rc = 0, est = 0, credits, blocks, allocated = 0;
01548         int                 bits, bs;
01549         int                 depth, size;
01550         loff_t              pos;
01551         ENTRY;
01552 
01553         LASSERT(buf != NULL);
01554         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01555 
01556         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01557         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle == NULL);
01558 
01559         size = buf->lb_len;
01560         bits = sb->s_blocksize_bits;
01561         bs = 1 << bits;
01562 
01563         if (_pos == -1) {
01564                 /* if this is an append, then we
01565                  * should expect cross-block record */
01566                 pos = 0;
01567         } else {
01568                 pos = _pos;
01569         }
01570 
01571         /* blocks to modify */
01572         blocks = ((pos + size + bs - 1) >> bits) - (pos >> bits);
01573         LASSERT(blocks > 0);
01574 
01575         if (inode != NULL && _pos != -1) {
01576                 /* object size in blocks */
01577                 est = (i_size_read(inode) + bs - 1) >> bits;
01578                 allocated = inode->i_blocks >> (bits - 9);
01579                 if (pos + size <= i_size_read(inode) && est <= allocated) {
01580                         /* looks like an overwrite, no need to modify tree */
01581                         credits = blocks;
01582                         /* no need to modify i_size */
01583                         goto out;
01584                 }
01585         }
01586 
01587         if (osd_extents_enabled(sb, inode)) {
01588                 /*
01589                  * many concurrent threads may grow tree by the time
01590                  * our transaction starts. so, consider 2 is a min depth
01591                  * for every level we may need to allocate a new block
01592                  * and take some entries from the old one. so, 3 blocks
01593                  * to allocate (bitmap, gd, itself) + old block - 4 per
01594                  * level.
01595                  */
01596                 depth = inode != NULL ? ext_depth(inode) : 0;
01597                 depth = max(depth, 1) + 1;
01598                 credits = depth;
01599                 /* if not append, then split may need to modify
01600                  * existing blocks moving entries into the new ones */
01601                 if (_pos == -1)
01602                         credits += depth;
01603                 /* blocks to store data: bitmap,gd,itself */
01604                 credits += blocks * 3;
01605         } else {
01606                 credits = osd_calc_bkmap_credits(sb, inode, size, _pos, blocks);
01607         }
01608         /* if inode is created as part of the transaction,
01609          * then it's counted already by the creation method */
01610         if (inode != NULL)
01611                 credits++;
01612 
01613 out:
01614 
01615         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_WRITE, credits);
01616 
01617         /* dt_declare_write() is usually called for system objects, such
01618          * as llog or last_rcvd files. We needn't enforce quota on those
01619          * objects, so always set the lqi_space as 0. */
01620         if (inode != NULL)
01621                 rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, i_uid_read(inode),
01622                                            i_gid_read(inode), 0, oh, obj, true,
01623                                            NULL, false);
01624         RETURN(rc);
01625 }
01626 
01627 static int osd_ldiskfs_writelink(struct inode *inode, char *buffer, int buflen)
01628 {
01629         /* LU-2634: clear the extent format for fast symlink */
01630         ldiskfs_clear_inode_flag(inode, LDISKFS_INODE_EXTENTS);
01631 
01632         memcpy((char *)&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data, (char *)buffer, buflen);
01633         LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_disksize = buflen;
01634         i_size_write(inode, buflen);
01635         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
01636 
01637         return 0;
01638 }
01639 
01640 int osd_ldiskfs_write_record(struct inode *inode, void *buf, int bufsize,
01641                              int write_NUL, loff_t *offs, handle_t *handle)
01642 {
01643         struct buffer_head *bh        = NULL;
01644         loff_t              offset    = *offs;
01645         loff_t              new_size  = i_size_read(inode);
01646         unsigned long       block;
01647         int                 blocksize = 1 << inode->i_blkbits;
01648         int                 err = 0;
01649         int                 size;
01650         int                 boffs;
01651         int                 dirty_inode = 0;
01652 
01653         if (write_NUL) {
01654                 /*
01655                  * long symlink write does not count the NUL terminator in
01656                  * bufsize, we write it, and the inode's file size does not
01657                  * count the NUL terminator as well.
01658                  */
01659                 ((char *)buf)[bufsize] = '\0';
01660                 ++bufsize;
01661         }
01662         while (bufsize > 0) {
01663                 if (bh != NULL)
01664                         brelse(bh);
01665 
01666                 block = offset >> inode->i_blkbits;
01667                 boffs = offset & (blocksize - 1);
01668                 size = min(blocksize - boffs, bufsize);
01669                 bh = ldiskfs_bread(handle, inode, block, 1, &err);
01670                 if (!bh) {
01671                         err = err ? err : -EIO;
01672                         CERROR("%s: error reading offset %llu (block %lu): "
01673                                "rc = %d\n",
01674                                inode->i_sb->s_id, offset, block, err);
01675                         break;
01676                 }
01677 
01678                 err = ldiskfs_journal_get_write_access(handle, bh);
01679                 if (err) {
01680                         CERROR("journal_get_write_access() returned error %d\n",
01681                                err);
01682                         break;
01683                 }
01684                 LASSERTF(boffs + size <= bh->b_size,
01685                          "boffs %d size %d bh->b_size %lu\n",
01686                          boffs, size, (unsigned long)bh->b_size);
01687                 memcpy(bh->b_data + boffs, buf, size);
01688                 err = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(handle, NULL, bh);
01689                 if (err)
01690                         break;
01691 
01692                 if (offset + size > new_size)
01693                         new_size = offset + size;
01694                 offset += size;
01695                 bufsize -= size;
01696                 buf += size;
01697         }
01698         if (bh)
01699                 brelse(bh);
01700 
01701         if (write_NUL)
01702                 --new_size;
01703         /* correct in-core and on-disk sizes */
01704         if (new_size > i_size_read(inode)) {
01705                 spin_lock(&inode->i_lock);
01706                 if (new_size > i_size_read(inode))
01707                         i_size_write(inode, new_size);
01708                 if (i_size_read(inode) > LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_disksize) {
01709                         LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_disksize = i_size_read(inode);
01710                         dirty_inode = 1;
01711                 }
01712                 spin_unlock(&inode->i_lock);
01713                 if (dirty_inode)
01714                         ll_dirty_inode(inode, I_DIRTY_DATASYNC);
01715         }
01716 
01717         if (err == 0)
01718                 *offs = offset;
01719         return err;
01720 }
01721 
01722 static ssize_t osd_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01723                          const struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *pos,
01724                          struct thandle *handle, int ignore_quota)
01725 {
01726         struct inode            *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01727         struct osd_thandle      *oh;
01728         ssize_t                 result;
01729         int                     is_link;
01730 
01731         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
01732 
01733         LASSERT(handle != NULL);
01734         LASSERT(inode != NULL);
01735         ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
01736 
01737         /* XXX: don't check: one declared chunk can be used many times */
01738         /* osd_trans_exec_op(env, handle, OSD_OT_WRITE); */
01739 
01740         oh = container_of(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01741         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
01742         osd_trans_exec_op(env, handle, OSD_OT_WRITE);
01743 
01744         /* Write small symlink to inode body as we need to maintain correct
01745          * on-disk symlinks for ldiskfs.
01746          * Note: the buf->lb_buf contains a NUL terminator while buf->lb_len
01747          * does not count it in.
01748          */
01749         is_link = S_ISLNK(dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr);
01750         if (is_link && (buf->lb_len < sizeof(LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data)))
01751                 result = osd_ldiskfs_writelink(inode, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
01752         else
01753                 result = osd_ldiskfs_write_record(inode, buf->lb_buf,
01754                                                   buf->lb_len, is_link, pos,
01755                                                   oh->ot_handle);
01756         if (result == 0)
01757                 result = buf->lb_len;
01758 
01759         osd_trans_exec_check(env, handle, OSD_OT_WRITE);
01760 
01761         return result;
01762 }
01763 
01764 static int osd_declare_punch(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01765                              __u64 start, __u64 end, struct thandle *th)
01766 {
01767         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01768         struct inode       *inode;
01769         int                 rc;
01770         ENTRY;
01771 
01772         LASSERT(th);
01773         oh = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01774 
01775         /*
01776          * we don't need to reserve credits for whole truncate
01777          * it's not possible as truncate may need to free too many
01778          * blocks and that won't fit a single transaction. instead
01779          * we reserve credits to change i_size and put inode onto
01780          * orphan list. if needed truncate will extend or restart
01781          * transaction
01782          */
01783         osd_trans_declare_op(env, oh, OSD_OT_PUNCH,
01784                              osd_dto_credits_noquota[DTO_ATTR_SET_BASE] + 3);
01785 
01786         inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01787         LASSERT(inode);
01788 
01789         rc = osd_declare_inode_qid(env, i_uid_read(inode), i_gid_read(inode),
01790                                    0, oh, osd_dt_obj(dt), true, NULL, false);
01791         RETURN(rc);
01792 }
01793 
01794 static int osd_punch(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01795                      __u64 start, __u64 end, struct thandle *th)
01796 {
01797         struct osd_thandle *oh;
01798         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
01799         struct inode       *inode = obj->oo_inode;
01800         handle_t           *h;
01801         tid_t               tid;
01802         int                rc = 0, rc2 = 0;
01803         ENTRY;
01804 
01805         LASSERT(end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF);
01806         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
01807         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
01808         LASSERT(inode != NULL);
01809         ll_vfs_dq_init(inode);
01810 
01811         LASSERT(th);
01812         oh = container_of(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
01813         LASSERT(oh->ot_handle->h_transaction != NULL);
01814 
01815         osd_trans_exec_op(env, th, OSD_OT_PUNCH);
01816 
01817         tid = oh->ot_handle->h_transaction->t_tid;
01818 
01819         i_size_write(inode, start);
01820         ll_truncate_pagecache(inode, start);
01821 #ifdef HAVE_INODEOPS_TRUNCATE
01822         if (inode->i_op->truncate) {
01823                 inode->i_op->truncate(inode);
01824         } else
01825 #endif
01826                 ldiskfs_truncate(inode);
01827 
01828         /*
01829          * For a partial-page truncate, flush the page to disk immediately to
01830          * avoid data corruption during direct disk write.  b=17397
01831          */
01832         if ((start & ~PAGE_MASK) != 0)
01833                 rc = filemap_fdatawrite_range(inode->i_mapping, start, start+1);
01834 
01835         h = journal_current_handle();
01836         LASSERT(h != NULL);
01837         LASSERT(h == oh->ot_handle);
01838 
01839         /* do not check credits with osd_trans_exec_check() as the truncate
01840          * can restart the transaction internally and we restart the
01841          * transaction in this case */
01842 
01843         if (tid != h->h_transaction->t_tid) {
01844                 int credits = oh->ot_credits;
01845                 /*
01846                  * transaction has changed during truncate
01847                  * we need to restart the handle with our credits
01848                  */
01849                 if (h->h_buffer_credits < credits) {
01850                         if (ldiskfs_journal_extend(h, credits))
01851                                 rc2 = ldiskfs_journal_restart(h, credits);
01852                 }
01853         }
01854 
01855         RETURN(rc == 0 ? rc2 : rc);
01856 }
01857 
01858 static int fiemap_check_ranges(struct inode *inode,
01859                                u64 start, u64 len, u64 *new_len)
01860 {
01861         loff_t maxbytes;
01862 
01863         *new_len = len;
01864 
01865         if (len == 0)
01866                 return -EINVAL;
01867 
01868         if (ldiskfs_test_inode_flag(inode, LDISKFS_INODE_EXTENTS))
01869                 maxbytes = inode->i_sb->s_maxbytes;
01870         else
01871                 maxbytes = LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_bitmap_maxbytes;
01872 
01873         if (start > maxbytes)
01874                 return -EFBIG;
01875 
01876         /*
01877          * Shrink request scope to what the fs can actually handle.
01878          */
01879         if (len > maxbytes || (maxbytes - len) < start)
01880                 *new_len = maxbytes - start;
01881 
01882         return 0;
01883 }
01884 
01885 /* So that the fiemap access checks can't overflow on 32 bit machines. */
01886 #define FIEMAP_MAX_EXTENTS     (UINT_MAX / sizeof(struct fiemap_extent))
01887 
01888 static int osd_fiemap_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01889                           struct fiemap *fm)
01890 {
01891         struct fiemap_extent_info fieinfo = {0, };
01892         struct inode *inode = osd_dt_obj(dt)->oo_inode;
01893         u64 len;
01894         int rc;
01895 
01896 
01897         LASSERT(inode);
01898         if (inode->i_op->fiemap == NULL)
01899                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
01900 
01901         if (fm->fm_extent_count > FIEMAP_MAX_EXTENTS)
01902                 return -EINVAL;
01903 
01904         rc = fiemap_check_ranges(inode, fm->fm_start, fm->fm_length, &len);
01905         if (rc)
01906                 return rc;
01907 
01908         fieinfo.fi_flags = fm->fm_flags;
01909         fieinfo.fi_extents_max = fm->fm_extent_count;
01910         fieinfo.fi_extents_start = fm->fm_extents;
01911 
01912         if (fieinfo.fi_flags & FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC)
01913                 filemap_write_and_wait(inode->i_mapping);
01914 
01915         rc = inode->i_op->fiemap(inode, &fieinfo, fm->fm_start, len);
01916         fm->fm_flags = fieinfo.fi_flags;
01917         fm->fm_mapped_extents = fieinfo.fi_extents_mapped;
01918 
01919         return rc;
01920 }
01921 
01922 static int osd_ladvise(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01923                        __u64 start, __u64 end, enum lu_ladvise_type advice)
01924 {
01925         int     rc;
01926         ENTRY;
01927 
01928         switch (advice) {
01929         default:
01930                 rc = -ENOTSUPP;
01931                 break;
01932         }
01933 
01934         RETURN(rc);
01935 }

01952         .dbo_declare_write_commit       = osd_declare_write_commit,
01953         .dbo_write_commit               = osd_write_commit,
01954         .dbo_read_prep                  = osd_read_prep,

01959 };
